channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned Lime Bikes, 15th June
item.description:
There is an abandoned Line bike in a privately owned parking bay 131 and two abandoned Lime Bikes in privately owned parking bay 134 in Garter Way. I heard some adolescents shouting and some large crashes of the bikes being thrown into the parking bays but couldn’t get to them before they ran away. Please can the bikes be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-11, Garter Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown tree, 15th June
item.description:
Over grown tree in the communal area behind is covering all daylight and sun from our gardens and house Lots of insects and mess is created because of this

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wimbourne Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Various potholes, 15th June
item.description:
The potholes have been there for a very long time and are getting worse. We are concerned that it’s impacting on the houses. The road is consistently being used by buses and the potholes have not been repaired for ages.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Ramillies Road, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor quality of pop hole repair, 15th June
item.description:
The council contractor has just filled a pot hole, however the works are of such poor quality, I hope the contractor will be recalled. It appears tarmac has just been thrown in the hole and has not even been wacked down with a wacker plate. The pothole is still not level by at least 20mm and can still cause damage to vehicles wheels or cyclists. The tarmac is still wet so likely when vehicles/buses drive over it, there will not be much left. This is where tax payers money is spent on poor quality repairs as it was will likely have to be repaired properly in the foreseeable future.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 283, Burnt Oak Lane, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Dangerous pedestrian crossing: Nearly hit twice within 20 min period on pedestrian crossing near Green Lane/aAden Grove junction, 15th June
item.description:
Nearly got hit by car while crossing pedestrian crossing. One car stopped and I was 1/3 of way over. Another car coming in opposite direction went through nearly hitting me. On way back, nearly got hit by lime bike that went through past taxi that stopped
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Green Lanes, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Anti-parking bollard coming out of ground, 15th June
item.description:
An anti parking bollard put in to prevent further damage to pavement slabs that had been broken by inappropriate parking is threatening to come out of the ground. At present only the concrete base the post is in is preventing it from coming out or falling over. Needs resetting in the ground. A danger to both pedestrians and cars coming around a blind corner from Bournwood Rd direction
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Kynaston Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
